results.title: Oasis in space: visions of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Philippe Cousteau, Andrew Solt, Andrew Solt Productions, Cousteau Society and Educational Media Corporation
results.brief_description:
Discussion of technological and scientific developments which lead to predictions of what the future may be like. Concentrates on the history of the Space Age - space flight, astronomy, scientific innovations, the effect of space technology on Earth’s economic development; marine life and the preservation of endangered species.
Narrated by Philippe Cousteau.

results.title: Oasis in space: troubled waters
results.creator_credit: Philippe Cousteau, Andrew Solt, Andrew Solt Productions and Cousteau Society
results.brief_description: Several environmentalists including Margaret Mead and Isaac Asimov discuss what needs to be done in order to reverse the polluted state of our waters. Narrated by Philippe Cousteau.

results.title: Oases: for city dwellers
results.brief_description: Shows some of the national parks of Western Germany which have been created to preserve the beauty of the landscapes as well as to provide beautiful peaceful recreational areas free from the noise and bustle of the industrial areas.

results.title: O.H.M.S.: royal visit to Australia 1963
results.brief_description: The royal visit of the Queen and Duke of Edinburgh to all Australian states in 1963. Shows a respresentative selection of the engagements undertaken by the Royal couple, and the behind the scenes activities of the Australian Post Office related to the visit. Also shows some good archival footage of the “south bank” area in Melbourne before the complex was developed. Narrated by T. Horton.

results.title: O dreamland
results.brief_description: One of the first films in the Free Cinema movement in British documentary production, Lindsay Anderson offers an insight into the British working class culture. Margate Amusement Park is depicted less a site of innocent levity than of vicarious sadism and quiet desperation. This observation of proletarian entertainment becomes as much a testament to the failure of Atlee’s social democracy as Orwell’s “1984”. A powerful film.

results.title: Nylon goes to work
results.creator_credit: R.Q. McNaughton, Harold Goodwin, British Nylon Spinners and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: Nylon is used for some of the toughest jobs in British industry. This film takes twelve examples to illustrate some of the material’s unique characteristics, ranging from nylon rope, such as that used to haul Thames barges, to the use of the material in fire hoses and the tyres of aircraft.

results.title: Nutritional needs of our bodies
results.brief_description: Using photomicrography, laboratory animals, and animation, shows how food provides the body’s basic needs. Describes the four general groups of foods, the nutrients which they contain, and what the nutrients supply to the body. The importance of a well-balanced diet to a strong body and good health is stressed.

results.title: Nutrition: the consumer and the supermarket
results.creator_credit: William C. Crain and Barr Films
results.brief_description: The supermarket offers convenience and a ready source of the food we need. But there are thousands of products on the supermarket shelves - how do we determine what to buy? Here consumer interviews are combined with an analysis of the products and merchandising techniques used in the market. Basic information is presented to assist the shopper.

results.title: Nutrition: the all-American meal
results.creator_credit: William C. Crain and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Analyses the nutritional and sociological implications of the “hamburger, chips and soft drink American diet.” Offers suggestions for improving the nutritional value of meals.

results.title: Nutrition and the pig
results.creator_credit: Bertram Tyrer, Dudley Birch, Birch Hill Film Productions and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: Shows research into the nutrition of the pig, whose digestive system strongly resembles that of humans. Explains how various problems are all related to specific nutritional deficiencies.
